page.title: 13Tourism in Prestbury
page.content: The tourist trade is important to Prestbury as it has several buildings of historic interest. Apart from St.Peter's Church,there is also Prestbury Hall.Originally,it was the home of an eminent doctor, Dr.Hope,renowned as a heart specialist.The Hall,at present,is divided into a number of flats. Next to Prestbury Hall is Williams and Glyns Bank,now called the Royal Bank of Scotland.This building was originally the village school,and was built in 1720.A later school was sited over the road.The present school is situated along Bollin Grove. There are several other old buildings in the centre of the village,including The Legh Arms,The Bridge Hotel,Swanwick House,the Manor House,Butley Hall,and the Brooks Cottages.
